content: No, I can't give this to Bailey Jones.

"You said you're going to help me right?"
I whispered into Chris Turner's ears as I approached them and handed the cure over. Both Turner and Jones looked at me in confusion.

"When did you get the cure?"
Bailey Jones looked panicked.

"I had the feeling that I couldn't trust you."
Jones indeed seemed to know much about me, but whenever I was with them I felt some kind of weird feeling as if something in my guts was sending me a warn signal.
I knew trusting my instincts was not always a wise thing to do, but it seemed like it was the best shot I had for now.
They seemed as if they wanted to say some more things but they just turned their head away.

"Andrea!"
"Pass me the cure, Turner."
It was just a few seconds later when I felt the sudden rush of my own hearbeats, and heard Bailey Jones' voice from right behind.

I felt something sharp on my neck.
It was a piece of a broken glass.
I could barely breathe, knowing that my life was at stake.

"Bear with. You're going to remember everything soon."
Jones whispered something I couldn't understand.

"Oh, Andrea."
"You're gonna pass me the cure, and I'm going to let Andrea go."
No. I silently said it, looking into Chris Turner's eyes. They looked so confused.
And at that moment I had a sudden realization that Jones has no intention to hurt me. They were holding the broken piece of glass but that was all. They were not pressing it against my neck.
I did not feel the glass touching my neck.
Alright, this person is not going to kill me.
Trying to make sure, I intentionally pulled their arm closer to my neck, and they seemed bewildered. It was the only chance. I managed to push them away.

"Now!"
Chris Turner ran over to me and Jones and injected the cure on Jones' arm.
Bailey Jones looked at me, stumbled, and fell onto the floor.

"I just wanted to get you back..."
They were frowning, but it rather seemed because of sadness than pain.
And I felt like I saw this scene before.

'Andrea.'
I think I heard Jones calling my name.
The dejavu made me feel so exhausted that I fell down.

'What was it?'
I had a short vision that Bailey Jones was in front of me. What is it, did I really know Jones?

"Andrea, are you okay?"
Chris Turner came to me to see if I was okay.

"We can make it out safely now."
Turner seemed relieved. They hugged me.
What if Turner was lying? What if I made a terrible decision? What's going to happen to Jones now?
And what's going to happen to me?

All these questions made me feel uneasy and extremely anxious.
"Andreaâ€¦!"
I could barely hear the voice as if I was sunk under water. And I think I saw someone smiling right before I closed my eyes.

Someone who has been collapsed on the floor got up slowly with a confused face.
They detected another body across the room.
Being surprised, they looked around to see what was going on

"You're awake! What a relief."
They turned their eyes to the direction of the somewhat familiar voice. The owner of the voice came and sat down in front of them.
"Nice to meet you. You're Bailey Jones, who was invited to deliver a lecture on anatomy today at NIPS. Unfortunately it had to be cancelled due to the rebel forces attacks."
"If you're suffering from a memory loss, don't be too worried. It's a temporary side effect of the medicine that you took. While you were fainted I injected you some tranquilizer."
"Oh, excuse me for the late introduction. I am Andrea Davies, a researcher of NIPS. I was supposed to be your assistant for today's lecture."
"We're going to be safe once we reach the exit at the Private Access Area. The government has promised to help us. I will try my best to protect you and help you escape safely."
Andrea Davies smiled at Bailey Jones.
"Shall we go?"
